article: russia 's decision to recognize the rebel georgian provinces of south ossetia and abkhazia as independent states was a `` deliberate violation of international law , '' swedish foreign minister carl bildt wrote on his blog tuesday .
abstract: sweden slams russian recognition of georgian regions
candidates: swedish foreign minister says russia's recognition of rebel provinces was a violation of international law.
russia recognized the rebel provinces of south ossetia and abkhazia as independent states.
swedish foreign minister carl bildt wrote on his blog t tuesday that russia's recognition of two regions as independent states was a deliberate violation of international law.

's foreign minister said russia's recognition of the two rebel provinces was a "deliberate violation of international law" sweden's foreign minister said russia recognized the rebel provinces as independent states.

russia 's decision to recognize the rebel georgian provinces of south ossetia and abkhazia as independent states was a deliberate violation of international law.
" russia's decision to recognize the rebel georgian provinces of south ossetia and abkhazia as independent states was a deliberate violation of international law," swedish foreign minister said.
swedish foreign minister says russia's recognition of rebel provinces was a violation of international law.
